title: Прекрасная церковь и смотровая площадка
text: Церковь святого Петра или Петерскирхе - старейшая церковь Мюнхена, первое упоминание о ней датируется 1225 годом. Первоначально церковь была построена в романском стиле, но в 1278 году была перестроена в готическую базилику. Высота колокольни церкви составляет 98 метров, на башне сохранились уникальные часы 1371 году с восемью циферблатами. Внутреннее убранство в стиле позднего барокко 18 века мы можем видеть сейчас. дополнен по обеим сторонам небольшими капеллами. Потолок центрального нефа украшен росписями, фресками, изображающие сцены из жизни апостола Петра. Алтарь в стиле барокко 1734 года так вообще отдельная достопримечательность. В центре святой Петр с золотой тиарой на голове сидит на троне. По обеим сторонам от Петра четыре фигуры святых: Амбросий, Августин, Иоганн и Афанасий с книгами в руках. Башня церкви до середины 20 века использовалась в качестве пожарной наблюдательной башни, сегодня это одна из лучших обзорных площадок. Главная реликвия церкви - святая Мундиция (Протогения) Римская, мученица, погибшая в 310 году.Вход в церковь свободный (церковь действующая), а вход на смотровую площадку стоит 3 евро для взрослых. Оцените свои силы перед подъемом, так как подняться можно только пешком по 304 ступенькам.

title: Salire sul campanile è necessario
text: Si trova alle spalle di uno dei lati di Marienplatz, il cuore di Monaco. La Peterskirche (Chiesa di San Pietro) è una delle chiese più importanti della città e, secondo me, la più bella, meglio della Frauenkirche (la Cattedrale). Gli interni sono in stile barocco. L’ingresso è gratuito ma per accedere alla torre campanaria si deve fare il biglietto al costo di 3€. Per raggiungere i 96 metri della sommità bisogna fare gli scalini tutti di un fiato e considerati i problemi di claustrofobia di mia moglie salgo solo io. È una bella faticata però all’arrivo la vista ripaga di tutto. Girando per tutto il perimetro della torre si gode, grazie alla bella giornata, la vista di tutta la città ed in particolare dell’intera Marienplatz e il Neues Rathaus che, visto dall'alto, si impone per la sua mole (spettacolare). La fatica per la salita è ben ripagata.

title: Приходская церковь Святого Петра
text: Приход впервые документально упоминается в 1225 году. Церковь расширялась и перестраивалась в 14 и в 17 веках и реконструировалась в 1946 на средства граждан города всех вероисповеданий и политических взглядов после войны. На что стоит обратить внимание - высокий алтарь в стиле барокко первой половины 18 века. В алтаре у ног Святого Петра четыре отца церкви: два западных- Амвросий и Августин и два восточных –Афанасий и Иоанн Златоуст. Потолочные фрески изображают жизнь апостола Петра. В  этой церкви можно увидеть большое количество средневековых произведений искусства.  В храме находится реликварий Святой Мундитии- покровительницы одиноких женщин. Также можно подняться на смотровую площадку, с которой в хорошую погоду открывается обзор до 100 км. Башенные часы являются старейшими в городе и имеют 8 циферблатов.

title: Climb the Tower
text: The interior is a lovely old church opened in 1294 where i did not spend the appropriate amount of time rather had another experience.  I always enjoy climbing a tower or two for the unique perspective it gives of a city.  Also interesting to see the construction as many are hundreds of years old.  The stairs can be narrow in some places, wider wood boards in others.  There are numerous places for pasting and a short rest if needed.  As you climb and look at the walls, floors, and inner sections you can see evidence of the repairs and damages through the ages.  Once to the top (about 300 feet or 91 meters) you are rewarded with a spectacular view of the city.  I chose to climb at 5pm (closing was at 6pm) to get an evening view which was just breathtaking.   Gave an enjoyable perspective and rewarded with some great photos.  Well with the 3 euro fee.

title: Too much wrong to make the trek up right
text: I really wanted to love this attraction - being so high above Munich, getting to see the city and the outlying parts from a different viewpoint, being awed by everything around us. But, it just didn't do it for us.It wasn't the stairs - there are something like 922 of them up, and they're steep and narrow, and two adults can't pass each other without one feeling like they're being crushed. At least it the ascent/decent isn't as windy/twisty as the stairs inside the Wallace National Monument in Scotland.It wasn't the crowded observatory deck, either. It, too, is narrow and hard to maneuver, if you're trying to get to one side of the deck, or even if you're trying to get to the exit.It's the fact that they did nothing to monitor the number of people on the stairs, on the platform, or in the "holding area" at the top. They took our money (3 euro per person) and ushered us into the first floor, which led us to the first flight of stairs. There's nowhere to pull over to appreciate the view, nothing sharing the history of the building or the tower or the city.When we finally got to the top - all of us winded but pretending not to be - we were stuck near the interior door, being blocked by people on the observation deck, and unfortunately blocking those people that wanted to get down.It took 20 minutes of waiting (and of some people around us getting very angry) before we were able to take our first steps out onto the deck. We took a ton of pictures from that viewpoint, and were keen to inch our way along the deck to see the view from other vantage points, but were blocked by a wall of people.Mind, it was the end of December, and bitterly cold with a fierce wind that day, so we were all huddled against the wall and each other as we waited for the people in front of us to move.And they just...didn't. Once we finally made our way around to the exit door, we found out that the entire pile-up was caused by a group of 3 teenage girls, who had apparently been on the deck for over 2 hours, and had been uninterested in scooching over enough to allow others to pass them.That caused a bit of tension between them and the group of 4 people behind us, who started to yell that they wanted to get down, and started trying to shove past all of us to do so. They did apologize to my husband and me, as they were shouldering past us on the way to the door, but they did not have a kind word to say to the 3 teens that caused them to be stuck up so high for so long.We did get a lot of wonderful pictures from the top, and it was pretty up there (despite the cold and rain...and tension and anger), but I would suggest planning your ascent around the busy times, if at all possible.

title: One of the oldest buildings in Munich
text: There are quite a few church visits you can make in the Old Town of Munich including Peterskirche (St. Peter's Church) just to the south of Marienplatz. This is a landmark building, one of the oldest in the city. The exterior is subtle, featuring a 91-metre tall tower, which can be climbed for views of the Old Town if interested. The interior of St. Peter's is nice as well. It is Baroque and Rococo in style, includes an attractive nave with columns lined with gilded statue figures. You'll find fine stucco work, ceiling frescos and an impressive high altar, the work of Erasmus Grasser (1492). The pulpit and side chapels are worth spending time to enjoy as well. Near the back entrance, there is historical information regarding church foundations and expansions through the centuries. In the end, you can easily spend 10-20 minutes enjoying the interior of St. Peter's Church. This church can conveniently included in sightseeing around Marienplatz and Viktualienmarkt area of the Old Town.

title: uralt...
text: Anno 1273 wurde diese prächtige Kirche Kirche im Gotischen Stil erbaut. Sie befindet sich am Rindermarkt in nächster Nähe zum Marienplatz. Während der großen Brandkatastrophe im Jahr 1327, dem ein Großteil der Stadt zum Opfer fiel, wurde auch die Kirche stark in Mitleidenschaft gezogen. In den folgenden Jahren bis 1386 wurde der Wiederaufbau betrieben, wobei auch der Turm mit seiner enormen Höhe von ca. 90 Metern geschaffen wurde. Durch Um- und Anbauten wurde auf dem Turm ein Rundgang errichtet, der einzigartge Ausblicke erlaubt.Im Frühjahr 1945 wurde kurz vor Kriegsende die Kirche sehr stark beschädigt, wobei bereits 1946 mit dem Wiederaufbau begonnen wurde, der 1954 in der heutigen Form abgeschlossen wurde. In der Höhe von 56 Metern kann man von der dortigen Plattform nach dem Besteigen von über 300 Stufen eine phantastische Fernsicht bishin zu den Alpen genießen.

text: 起源は12世紀に遡るミュンヘンで最も古い教会の一つ。身廊も素晴らしいですが，何といってもアルトペーターの愛称で呼ばれている時計塔には是非とも登ってみたい。新市庁舎の時計塔にもエレベーターで昇ることはできますが，どちらか選ぶなら，足腰に不安がないのであれば，新市庁舎とマリエン広場を上から一望できるこちらに昇りたい。訪問時は，土曜日の16時過ぎ頃。列ができており，入場まで10分ほど待たされました。展望スペースがそれほど広くないため，入場を制限しているようです。階段は，302段で，結構狭いので，階段途中での上下のすれ違いやお先にどうぞというのは難しいですが，所々に踊り場があったりしますので，マイペースで昇ることができます。一気に昇れば５～６分で昇れます。　展望台の幅も狭く，訪問時は混んでいたので，ー周するのを断念しました。展望台からは，新市庁舎，マリエン広場はもちろん，旧市庁舎，フラウエン教会，ティアテア―教会などが見渡せます。また，ここから新市庁舎のグロッケンシュピールが動くのを眺めるということもできるでしょう。

title: Disappointing management of crowds.
text: This was going to be one of the highlights of our trip to Munich - a beautiful Tuesday in August with stunning views of the city and compared with lots of similar attraction pretty cheap. The entrance to the tower is through a small door and you start climbing a narrow staircase (properly narrow, as in shoulders brushing the wall either side). I assumed that it was a one-way system with people descending via a different staircase - until I met the first people coming down. At various points on the way up we had to give way and allow people to pass but it was bearable. When we got to the top, there were two exits to the outside of the tower and signs indicating that visitors should walk round in one direction. However you could go out of either the left hand or right hand entrance which on the busy day that we visited had resulted in gridlock. After 10 minutes waiting, with the queue behind me now blocking the stairs, preventing people from descending, my wife and son made it out on to the walkway round the tower. A further 5 minutes later and I made it outside too, having moved 3 meters in 15 minutes. At this point I received a text from my wife a few places ahead of me, suggesting that I give up and go down as she and my son were stuck and couldn't move forwards or backwards. It took a further 20 minutes to negotiate the queue on the narrow staircase in order to descend. Such a shame - the little that I saw of the view did indeed look good, but the disorganisation, lack of staff and total and complete lack of management was appalling. If you're visiting on a wet day in January, I'm sure you'll be able to sprint up and down the stairs without issue, but if you want to visit on a nice day in summer, I can't recommend it.

title: Красивая церковь
text: Церковь Святого Петра – самая старая приходская церковь Мюнхена. Мюнхенцы называют его «Alter Peter» (Старина Петер). Высота его колокольни - 92 метра.Построили церковь в романском стиле в XI веке на холме Петерсбергль на месте старой деревянной церкви.В 1181 году по указанию Отто I Виттельсбаха церковь была расширена, после чего освящена епископом Отто фон Фризингом. В 1284 году церковь снесли и построили на её месте новую. В XIV веке церковь пережила большой пожар, была сильно разрушена. В том же веке её восстановили, но уже в готическом стиле.В дальнейшем церковь неоднократно перестраивалась, меняла свой облик. В XVIII веке она была переделана архитектором Иоганном Баптистом Циммерманом в стиле рококо.Главное украшение церкви  – алтарь, изготовленный в 1733 году братьями Азам. Мастера соорудили величественную сцену в духе барокко с фигурами четырех святых, коринфскими колоннами и бархатно-золотистым задником. В центре всей композиции восседает монументальная фигура Святого Петра в папской тиаре . Для мюнхенцев он служит олицетворением папской власти.Наверху колокольни, на высоте 56 метров, под часами, устроена обзорная площадка.

Lo scheletro è decorato da alcune ietre preziose e all'interno del teschio sono posti anche due occhi finti.In conclusione direi che la chiesa merita una visita, anche breve (l'ingresso è gratuito, ma è sempre possibile fare un'offerta), suggerisco ampiamente di salire sul campanile.

title: A vista da Torre é uma das melhores da cidade
text: Situada no coração do centro histórico de Munique, mesmo ao lado da Marienplatz a Igreja de São Pedro é uma das igrejas mais antigas de cidade e da Alemanha. Construída no Sec. XXI já foi reconstruída duas vezes. Primeiro no Sec. XIV após um incêndio e por último, já no Sec. XX depois da Segunda Guerra Mundial. Nestas circunstâncias é normal que hoje se apresente com uma mistura de estilos arquitetônicos que vão do barroco ao gótico.  No interior da igreja, apesar de não ser permitido fotografar, destaca-se a rica ornamentação do altar, as escultura de um Santo em cada pilhar da nave central e os frescos no tecto. Existe ainda uma invulgar capela com um esqueleto de uma Santa coberto de ouro e decorado com pedras preciosas. Sem dúvida uma obra intrigante e pouco usual.A Igreja possui ainda uma torre com aproximadamente  90 metros de altura, que oferece vistas a 360º de toda a cidade. A subida custa 3 euros por pessoa e é feita no exterior através de vários lances de escadas a maioria delas em madeira, que no seu todo são mais de 300 degraus. O esforço não é pequeno, mas vale bem a pena as vistas do miradouro são espetaculares.

text: マリエン広場に立って正面に新市庁舎とグロッケンシュピールを仰ぎ見る時 右背後の方向に、つまりマリエン広場の南東側に接する道路 Lindermarkt リンダーマルクトを3〜5分歩いたところに、Peterskirche ペータースキルヒェ(聖ペーター教会)があります。マリエン広場の華やかさが嘘のよう、教会周辺はダウンタウンのようなやや地味な印象です。教会自体は ミュンヘン最古(13世紀)の Pfarrkirche プファールキルヒェ(教区教会)ですが、第二次世界大戦でダメージを受け 戦後再建されたそう。教会礼拝堂はGotische Basilika ゴシック様式バシリカと呼ばれる四角形の構造です。礼拝堂内のArkade アーケード部分の柱の要所要所に設置されている像と 中央祭壇は金色で 白い壁とのコントラストが鮮やかです。天井には美しいフレスコ画が描かれています。時間と体力(健脚)のある方は 別の外扉から塔へ登れます。

title: Working church

title: 展望台に登ってみては・・・

title: Прекрасные виды с колокольни.
text: Внутренние объёмы , интерьер и потолки с витражами безусловно замечательные, но все таки главным впечатлением от храма стали  неповторимые виды на солнечный Мюнхен с вершины колокольни. Забраться туда может любой человек средних физических кондиций. Мне 60 и спортом я занимаюсь не постоянно, однако восхождение на 90 метров для меня стало несложным. Виды , открывающиеся с обзорной площадки, окупают с лихвой все физические затраты и неудобства подъёма. Редко где в Европе, вот так в центре сатрого города есть обзорная площадка. Очень рекомендую.

title: Pretty Views from the Tower
text: This is at heart a functioning church so if you are just coming to sightsee, make sure your visit does not coincide with services.  Visitors are not welcome to roam around freely when services are in progress and if you venture too far, you will be informed you've made a mistake in a tone that requires no translation!  On that note... the entrance to climb the tower is accessible from the outside of the church so don't go looking for it inside if you don't want to incur the (understandable) wrath of an angry geriatric German.  The inside of the church is lovely, but it is also a modern reconstruction as the church was nearly destroyed in WW2.  If you decide to climb the tower, your effort will be rewarded with a pretty view of Munich.  You will also be in what other reviewers have described as a "cage" without much room to move, so there is that.  I made it up the stairs just fine as someone in average shape, but if you're not in decent shape I don't recommend trying to get up there.  It's hot and crowded on the steps.  The tower is a unique experience, but this was really not my favorite church in the area.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Super vyhlídka
text: Interiér kostela je velmi krásný a stojí za návštěvu. Ještě úchvatnější je ale výhled z věže kostela. Vstupné jen 3 eura, výstup je poměrně zdlouhavý - věž je opravdu hodně vysoká. Pozor na špičku - kapacita vrcholu věže je poměrně omezená, místo je vyhlášené, proudí sem davy lidí. V turistické špičce se tedy může stát, že budete čekat zablokováni někde po cestě nahoru nebo dolu. Výhled je ale opravdu fantastický a stojí za to.

title: BEAUTIFUL
text: I would 100% recommended fitting this in to your trip to Munich. As well as being stunning from the outside, inside blows you away. The ceiling is mesmerising and so so beautiful. The calmness and serenity inside it just so peaceful. I would most definitely recommend paying the 3 euros to climb the tower for a view of the Marienplatz, you won’t regret it. Although not the most comfortable walk up (it’s 300 stairs and very cramped and hot, also people walking down the same way) if you can get over all that it’s worth it when you get to the top. Although very small and not much room to walk about,It’s still worth it for the views, especially being able to see the full scale of the Town Hall Building. I would most definitely recommend doing this!

title: Great Views of the City and Marienplatz
text: The Church of St Peter is one of Munich's main landmarks as it is the oldest church in the city and has a 300 foot bell tower with an observation deck at 184 feet offering a panoramic view and great photo opportunity over the Old Town and the Marienplatz.  If you want to take advantage of this view, you have to climb 299 steps as there is no elevator. When the weather is clear, it is said that you can see all the way to the Alps.  There is a small 3 euro entrance fee to the observation deck which is open from 10 AM to 6 PM.   Inside the church is a magnificent 18th century gilded high altar and large ceiling frescos.  A very macabre display in the church is located in the second chapel on the left side.  There you will find the skeleton remains of St Mundita which is gilded in gold and covered with precious stones.  Jewels even adorn her rotted teeth and false eyes.   Mass times at the church are Saturday evening at 6 PM and Sunday 7:30 AM, 9:30 AM, 11:30 AM and 6 PM.  Weekday masses are at 8:30 AM 10 AM, 11:30 AM and 6 PM.  On many Sundays throughout the year (especially during significant church holidays) you can hear members of the Munich orchestra and the Chamber Choir St Peters perform Viennese classical music, South German romantic works and even contemporary music.

title: Outstanding Church
text: On my last full day in Munich I stayed close to Marienplatz and visited several historic churches.  My first stop was Saint Peter’s Church, the oldest church in the district. Before the foundation of Munich as a city in 1158, there had been a pre-Merovingian church on this site.  Eighth century monks lived around this church on a hill called Petersbergl.  Every time I am in Munich I make it a point to visit the remarkable church.
